title: 109_hr3864
content: The Act may be cited as the Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities Affected by Hurricane Katrina or Rita Act of 2005. It provides assistance for individuals with disabilities. The section defines key terms related to individuals with disabilities affected by Hurricane Katrina, including "affected State," "Commissioner," "individual with a disability," and "individual with a disability affected by Hurricane Katrina." The text defines terms related to individuals with disabilities affected by Hurricane Katrina and Rita, including "individual with a disability affected by Hurricane Rita" and "major disaster." It also mentions reallotments of amounts to affected States under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 for fiscal year 2005. For fiscal year 2005, the Commissioner may grant waivers of non-Federal share requirements to affected States or Louisiana if funds are reallocated or returned due to inability to meet contribution requirements. The term "non-Federal share requirements" refers to those applicable to programs under title I of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973. An affected State receiving reallotted funds under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 for fiscal year 2005 can use the amounts for vocational rehabilitation services for individuals with disabilities affected by Hurricanes Katrina or Rita to support economic growth and community development. The text chunk discusses providing vocational rehabilitation services for individuals with disabilities affected by Hurricanes Katrina and Rita to support reconstruction and disaster assistance activities in specific areas. To provide vocational rehabilitation services for individuals with disabilities affected by Hurricane Rita, not meeting the State's selection criteria under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, or to carry out activities in accordance with the Act.
